intro: Erigeron mixtus, commonly known as the Mixed Fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron mixtus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
